intro: Weinmannia machupicchuensis, commonly known as the Machu Picchu Weinmannia, is a shrub native to the high-altitude regions of Peru. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypress and juniper trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, scale-like leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
